gurmukhi: sÍ`C isMG jb mwrXo smr isMG kIXo kop ] nh BwjXo liK smr ko rhXo su diRV pg rop ]1288]
transliteration: Svachchh Singh Jab Mdaryo Samar Singh Keeyo Kop|| Nah Bhaajyo Lakh(i) Samar Ko Rahyo Su Drid Pag Rop||1288||
translation: When Svachh Singh was killed, then Samar Singh was extremely enraged; seeing the war, hes resisted Krishna with firm feet.1288.

gurmukhi: ros kY bIr blI Ais lY Aiq hI Bt sRI jdubIr ky mwry ] Aaur ikqy igir Gwiel hÍY ikqny rn BUmih hwr pDwry ]
transliteration: Ros Kai Beer Balias(i) Lai At(i) Hibhat Srijadoubeer Ke Mdare|| Aur Kite Gir(i) Ghaail Hvai Kitne Ran Bhoomah(i) Haar Padhdare||
translation: Taking his sword in his hand, that mighty warrior killed many warriors of Krishna; many warriors were wounded and many of them fled away suffering defeat in the battlefield;

gurmukhi: sXwm jU pY ieh BwNq khXo smrys blI iqh qy hm hwry ] kwSI mY ijau klvqR vhY iqm bIrn cIr kY dÍY kir fwry ]1289]
transliteration: Syaam Joo Pai Eh Bhaant Kahyo Samres Balitih Te Ham Hdare|| Kaadhimai Jio Kalvatra Vahai Tim Bderan Cheer Kai Dvai Kar(i) Ddare||1289||
translation: The warriors shouted loudly, “We are being defeated by the mighty Samar Singh because he continues to shop into halves the warriors like the chopping saw of Kashi.1289.

gurmukhi: boil khXo hir jU dl mY Bt hY koaU jo Air sMg lrY ] auhko bhu AsqR shY qn mY Apny auih aUpr SsqR krY ]
transliteration: Bol(i) Kahyo Har(i) Joo Dal Mai Bhat Hai Ko( i)  Jo Ar(i) San Darai|| Ounko Bahu Astra Sahai Tan Mai Apne Uh(i) Oopar Shastraa Darai||
translation: Krishna said loudly within his army, “Who is that warrior, who will fight with the enemy? Who will endure the blows of his arms and inflict blows on him with his weapons?”

gurmukhi: inj pwn pY pwn Dry Gn sXwm su koie n bIrn lwj DrY ] rn mY js ko soaU tIko lhY smrys ko ju`D qy nwih trY ]1290]
transliteration: Nij Paan Pai Paan Ddare Ghan Syaam Su Koe Na Bderan Laaj Ddarai|| Ran Mai Jas Ko Sooo Teeko Lahai Samres Ko Juddh Te Naah(i) Darai||1290||
translation: Krishna was holding the betal leaf in his hand, so that some warrior may take up this responsibility, but none of the warriors thought of his honour and custom, the frontal mark of approbation will only be obtained by him, who will not run while fighting

gurmukhi: bhuq ju`Du suBtin krXo khw krY blvwn ] Awhv isMG blI huqo mwNg lIey iqh pwn ]1291]
transliteration: Bahout Juddh(u) Soubhatan(i) Daryo Kahaa Darai Balvaan|| Oohav Singh Balihouto Maan Leee Tih Paan||1291||
translation: Many warriors have fought a great deal and the mighty Ahav Singh from amongst them asked for that betal leaf.1291.

gurmukhi: koaU pRSn ieh TwN krY ikau n lry biRjrwj ] Xh au`qr hY qwih ko kauqk dyKn kwj ]1292]
transliteration: Ko( i)  Prashan Eh Thaan Darai Kio Na Dare Brij-raaj|| Yah Outtar Hai Taah(i) Ko Kaoutak Dekhan Kaaj||1292||
translation: Some may raise a question here – Why Krishna, the Lord of Braja, does not fight himself? The answer is – He is doing this only to see the sport himself.1292.
